channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Newly released video shows chaos and confusion after Trump assassination attempt
item.description: Dramatic footage shows for the first time the moment one officer encounters the shooter minutes before he opens fire on former President Trump's rally.
item.content:encoded:
Dramatic footage shows for the first time the moment one officer encounters the shooter minutes before he opens fire on former President Trump's rally.

(Image credit: Butler Township Police Department)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Team USA secures two Olympic medals in women's long jump
item.description: Tara Davis-Woodhall and Jasmine Moore clinched gold and bronze, respectively, in the event.
item.content:encoded:
Tara Davis-Woodhall and Jasmine Moore clinched gold and bronze, respectively, in the event.

(Image credit: Christian Petersen)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Australia dashes U.S. women's water polo gold medal dreams
item.description: The women's team was hoping to secure a record-breaking fourth straight gold medal in the Summer Games.
item.content:encoded:
The women's team was hoping to secure a record-breaking fourth straight gold medal in the Summer Games.

(Image credit: Clive Rose)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: 3 Columbia deans resign over texts that 'touched on ... antisemitic tropes'
item.description: The three deans were texting sarcastic and mocking messages about students’ complaints of antisemitism during a panel discussion on Jewish life on campus last May.
item.content:encoded:
The three deans were texting sarcastic and mocking messages about students’ complaints of antisemitism during a panel discussion on Jewish life on campus last May.

(Image credit: Diane Bondareff)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone smashes her world record in 400m hurdles, wins Olympic gold
item.description: The American finished finished her gold medal run in the 400m hurdles 1.5 seconds faster than her teammate Anna Cockrell who won silver. McLaughlin-Levrone also bested her world record.
item.content:encoded:
The American finished finished her gold medal run in the 400m hurdles 1.5 seconds faster than her teammate Anna Cockrell who won silver. McLaughlin-Levrone also bested her world record.

(Image credit: Elsa)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Justice Department wants more time on Trump election interference case
item.description: The Justice Department is asking for more time to share next steps in the federal election interference case against former President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
The Justice Department is asking for more time to share next steps in the federal election interference case against former President Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: After two months, astronauts stranded at the ISS may have a way back home
item.description: For two astronauts, an eight day mission to the International Space Station has stretched into two months due to vehicle issues. Now, NASA says it's considering bringing them back in a SpaceX capsule.
item.content:encoded: For two astronauts, an eight day mission to the International Space Station has stretched into two months due to vehicle issues. Now, NASA says it's considering bringing them back in a SpaceX capsule.
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: Israel detains soldiers on allegations of sexual assault of a detainee from Gaza
item.description: Israel has detained a group of soldiers on allegations that they sexually assaulted a Gazan detainee. It’s one of the most prominent cases of abuse that authorities have investigated during the war.
item.content:encoded: Israel has detained a group of soldiers on allegations that they sexually assaulted a Gazan detainee. It’s one of the most prominent cases of abuse that authorities have investigated during the war.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Here's what happened at the Olympic track and field events tonight
item.description: At the Paris Olympics Thursday evening, the United States has a real possibility of winning several gold medals at track and field events.
item.content:encoded: At the Paris Olympics Thursday evening, the United States has a real possibility of winning several gold medals at track and field events.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: The Root Cause of the Race Riots in the UK
item.description: For over a week race riots have broken out in the United Kingdom, mostly in smaller, poorer, less diverse cities. The violence has been stoked by misinformation and disinformation online. Our reporter travels to one of the places that saw mob violence to understand why it's happening.
item.content:encoded:
For over a week race riots have broken out in the United Kingdom, mostly in smaller, poorer, less diverse cities. The violence has been stoked by misinformation and disinformation online. Our reporter travels to one of the places that saw mob violence to understand why it's happening.

(Image credit: Dan Kitwood)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer
